pack_ice_processor moduleÔÉÅ

class pack_ice_processor.PackIceProcessor(sim_name, json_path=None, roll_win=None, P_log=None)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Class to compute Pack Ice metrics from sea ice model output.

This processor uses a rolling time window to compute spatial and temporal statistics of pack ice from a CICE-based sea ice model simulation. Pack ice is defined as sea ice with concentration above a threshold and speed above a threshold (i.e., not fast ice).

Parameters:

  • sim_name (str) ‚Äì Name of the simulation (used to look up paths and configs).

  • json_path (str, optional) ‚Äì Path to the JSON config file. Defaults to the default project config.

  • roll_win (int, optional) ‚Äì Rolling window (in days) for averaging. Defaults to value in config (usually 15).

  • P_log (str or Path, optional) ‚Äì File path to write logs. If None, logs are saved to logs/PackIceProcessor_{sim_name}.log.

configÔÉÅ

JSON configuration dictionary.

Type:

dict

roll_winÔÉÅ

Rolling window size in days.

Type:

int

var_listÔÉÅ

List of CICE variable names to load.

Type:

list

chunk_dictÔÉÅ

Dictionary defining chunking strategy for Dask/xarray.

Type:

dict

FI_threshÔÉÅ

Speed threshold (m/s) to distinguish fast ice (not used in pack ice masking).

Type:

float

SIC_threshÔÉÅ

Concentration threshold for sea ice to be considered pack ice.

Type:

float

SIC_scaleÔÉÅ

Scaling factor for area-based computations (e.g., to convert m^2 to 10^6 km^2).

Type:

float

cm2m_factÔÉÅ

Conversion factor from cm to m (typically 0.01).

Type:

float

sim_dirÔÉÅ

Directory containing simulation daily NetCDF files.

Type:

Path

CICE_dictÔÉÅ

Dictionary of CICE-specific configuration values.

Type:

dict

regrid_weights_pathÔÉÅ

Path to precomputed regridding weights file for u- to t-grid interpolation.

Type:

str or Path

gi_processorÔÉÅ

Instance for grid and mask operations. GI is not used for pack ice.

Type:

GroundedIcebergProcessor

use_giÔÉÅ

Always False for pack ice processor.

Type:

bool

Example

Simple single-date use case:

>>> from datetime import datetime
>>> PI_proc = PackIceProcessor("Rothrock")
>>> PI = PI_proc.process_window(datetime(1994, 9, 8), save_zarr=False)

Looping over a full simulation (recommended usage):

See the external loop driver script compute_pack_ice.py, which uses this class to process a time series:

python: from datetime import datetime, timedelta from pack_ice_processor import PackIceProcessor

dt_start = datetime(1993, 1, 1) dt_end = datetime(1999, 12, 31) processor = PackIceProcessor(‚ÄúRothrock‚Äù, roll_win=15) current_date = dt_start + timedelta(days=15)

while current_date <= dt_end - timedelta(days=15):

PI = processor.process_window(current_date) current_date += timedelta(days=15)

See full codebase at: https://github.com/dpath2o/AFIM

apply_PI_mask(roll_dict)[source]ÔÉÅ

Apply pack ice mask based on concentration and speed thresholds.

Parameters:

roll_dict (dict) ‚Äì Dictionary of rolling-averaged variables.

Returns:

  • masked_dict (dict) ‚Äì Dictionary with pack ice mask applied.

  • pi_mask (xarray.DataArray) ‚Äì Boolean mask array where pack ice criteria are met.

compute_pack_ice_outputs(roll_mask_vars)[source]ÔÉÅ

Compute summary metrics and spatial/temporal diagnostics from masked variables.

This is the backbone method of the class and is intended to be called from the process_window() method. It performs the heavy-lifting for summarising pack ice across multiple time scales and dimensions.

Parameters:

roll_mask_vars (dict) ‚Äì Dictionary of masked and rolled variables.

Returns:

PI ‚Äì Output dataset containing 1D, 2D, and 3D pack ice metrics.

Return type:

xarray.Dataset

Notes

This method computes metrics like total area, volume, mechanical/thermo growth, stress, shear, divergence, aging, speed, and frazil formation. Includes both time-series, coarsened 3D fields, and spatial frequency summaries.

Compute rolling averages over specified time window for relevant variables.

Parameters:

ds (xarray.Dataset) ‚Äì Dataset to compute rolling means on.

Returns:

roll_dict ‚Äì Dictionary of rolled variables including derived metrics.

Return type:

dict of xarray.DataArray

process_window(dtC, hemisphere='south', ow_zarrs=False, save_zarr=True)[source]ÔÉÅ

High-level method to process a centered time window and save Zarr output.

Parameters:

  • dtC (datetime) ‚Äì Center date of the rolling window.

  • hemisphere (str, optional) ‚Äì Hemisphere to process (‚Äònorth‚Äô or ‚Äòsouth‚Äô). Default is ‚Äòsouth‚Äô.

  • ow_zarrs (bool, optional) ‚Äì If True, overwrite existing Zarr outputs. Default is False.

  • save_zarr (bool, optional) ‚Äì Whether to save output to disk as a Zarr store. Default is True.

Returns:

PI ‚Äì Dataset with processed pack ice metrics.

Return type:

xarray.Dataset
